CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper October 9, 1954, pg. 10, reads: "Samuel Jaffe and Frank Silvera in 'St. Joan.'" Portion of "Toki Types" column by Toki Schalk Johnson in which image appears reads: "Stage Comes to Life - This week in Pittsburgh was a stand-out theatrically speaking... not just because the Nixon lit-up its stage and its season Monday night... but because in the play, 'St. Joan,' starring adorable Jean Arthur... a certain chap named Silvera... Frank Silvera... stepped once more into our life with a magnificent rave performance. Frank Silvera is a Bostonian... a 'few' years ago... we were both members of the late, lamented, but never forgotten Boston Players, an amateur group. As he says, our paths were straight... his continued into play after play... movie after movie... to TV... while we went straight on with our fiction writing... and on into newspaper work."
TitMainTitle: Actors Samuel Jaffe and Frank Silvera in monk and priest costumes for production of "St. Joan," in dressing room of Nixon Theatre
